text: Today's #SocialDistancing Activity: chopping wood for next year. Can you do it better? #FlattenTheCurve https://t.co/5YIkdctLC3

On my website https://t.co/rTg6WpSMSS you can find the most up-to-date information on the coronavirus pandemic. My office is available as a resource for individuals, families, and businesses coping with this pandemic. #vtpoli

Thanks to the over 8,500 Vermonters who joined me tonight for all or part of my statewide telephone town hall meeting on the coronavirus pandemic. I am grateful for the thoughtful questions and feedback I received. https://t.co/FaMErMLh1w

I‚Äôll also be joined by @LindsayKurrle, Secretary of the VT Agency of Commerce and Community Development, and Darcy Carter, District Director of @SBA_Vermont. We‚Äôre looking forward to your questions! #vtpoli

Today at 4:50pm, I‚Äôll be hosting a live statewide telephone town hall on the assistance available for people impacted by the coronavirus pandemic with @SenSanders and @SenatorLeahy. I hope you‚Äôll join in. To participate, dial 866-641-6916 anytime between 4:50pm and 5:50pm.

Today is #VTEqualPayDay. Did you know that on average women make 80 cents for every dollar paid to a man in a similar job and women of color make even less? It‚Äôs time to end pay disparity. Equal work deserves equal pay. It‚Äôs as simple as that. #vtpoli #EqualPayDay
This great website from @SBA is a good start. And you can always contact my office for additional info. #vtpoli https://t.co/7g9ccrgBN5

Small businesses are the backbone of Vermont‚Äôs cities and towns. The new programs in the #CARESAct can help small businesses during this challenging time, but we need to ensure it‚Äôs easy for businesses to access this help.

It‚Äôs long overdue to deploy high speed internet to every inch of rural America to close this divide! #vtpoli https://t.co/WEqKVuWRJa

With schools closed, Vermont teachers and students are dealing with a ‚Äúhomework gap‚Äù. The #coronavirus pandemic is exposing a bleak daily reality for many Vermonters ‚Äì the #digitaldivide in rural areas prevents kids from learning online at home. #vtpoli
To every front line provider‚Äîfirst responder, nurse, PA, doctor, assistant, janitor‚Äîfighting this #coronavirus outbreak who can‚Äôt work from home: We thank you and won‚Äôt forget you. #vtpoli
Expanding food security programs to make sure families have access to SNAP funds and kids get the meals they need if their school is closed.
Two weeks of paid sick leave and up to three months of paid family and medical leave so that workers can stay home if they are sick or need to be quarantined.
Testing, testing, testing. The bill makes sure that coronavirus testing is FREE for all Americans.

Last night the House acted decisively to protect public health and the financial security of families impacted by the #coronavirus outbreak. The Senate and President must act now to put these protections into law. #vtpoli  

Specifically, the bill includes:

There is no excuse for keeping health experts in the dark about #coronavirus. President Trump needs to allow the experts to do their jobs without his political interference. #vtpoli https://t.co/z0GqnEcvhZ

We‚Äôve adopted a few tips from the @CDCgov in my office to help keep staff & visitors healthy. We found their recommendations on how to reduce the potential spread of #coronavirus helpful. Vermont is leading the way to cut down on plastic pollution ‚Äî it‚Äôs time for Congress to do its part. This week we introduced federal legislation to reduce plastic pollution that too often ends up in landfills, in the ocean, or as litter. #vtpoli

I sat down with @RepJohnCurtis to talk about the Recreational Trails Program Full Funding Act that we introduced this week. This bipartisan bill will nearly triple the funding for this program that builds recreational trails in Vermont and across America. #vtpoli https://t.co/BG86oNPX6f

Today, the House finally reaffirmed its constitutional responsibility regarding the use of military force. I fought hard for two bills that will stop President Trump from getting us into a war with Iran as a result of his erratic use of military force. #NoWarWithIran #vtpoli

Tomorrow I‚Äôll be hosting a Congress in Your Community event at 12:15 at the Birdseye Diner in Castleton. I want to hear your concerns and offer assistance with federal agencies. I hope you can stop by! #vtpoli https://t.co/zKeeGxRZMY

Congrats to @MAMAVA for selling 1,000 lactation suites. These suites give moms a private place to express milk or take care of their babies in busy spaces. This is social enterprise at its best ‚Äì a business creating a solution for an important social need. https://t.co/LqCGna5HaZ

Vermont businesses continue to innovate and pave the way for a cleaner, greener future. Friday I visited @Beeswrap, a Middlebury business crafting sustainable food storage solutions to cut down on plastic waste in our kitchens. They‚Äôre the bee‚Äôs knees! #beeswrapüêù https://t.co/jnBdcf1TBD

On the 47th anniversary of #RoevWade, women‚Äôs rights are under attack across the country. I am fighting to block outrageous attacks on women‚Äôs health and proud that Vermont is a leader in protecting women‚Äôs rights. #vtpoli

10 years ago the #CitizensUnited decision opened the floodgate of corporate & unregulated dark money in our elections. The House-passed #ForThePeopleAct will keep billionaires & corporations with blank checks out of our political process. Time for the Senate to act. #vtpoli https://t.co/hQpAzqZ3cp

America's long journey to achieve MLK's dream where a person is not judged by the color of his skin but the content of his character is under assault. But the memory of Dr. Martin Luther King sustains me, and I think millions of Americans. #MLKDay

While the victim of violence, he spoke of love. While the road ahead was long and arduous, he spoke of hope and commitment. While he worked in a hostile South surrounded by people who wished him harm, he spoke of forgiveness. #MLKDay

Before the annual gathering, we all attended church at the Ebenezer Baptist Church where MLK was the pastor. I don‚Äôt remember his exact words, but I remember like it was yesterday how his words stirred me. #MLKDay

In the summer of 1967, I was working with a community organization on the West Side of Chicago. In August, I traveled with a group of young people to Atlanta to attend the annual convention of Dr. King‚Äôs Southern Christian Leadership Conference. #MLKDay https://t.co/Sty2b92rsx
Congress must act swiftly to protect our upcoming election from foreign interference. The Senate can start by passing the SHIELD Act we sent them in October. #vtpoli

In July, Bob Mueller told me in testimony before the Intelligence Committee that he feared foreign interference in our elections would be the ‚Äúnew normal.‚Äù He was right. #vtpoli https://t.co/B3jpj2Za9M
